citations.narrative:
The facility is housing at least 10 rabbits in enclosures that do not provide adequate space. The facility has approval for
use of innovative primary enclosures that do not precisely meet the space requirements in the AWA regulations for rabbits
weighing less than 11.9lbs. At least 10 rabbits that weighed more than 11.9lbs (12.5-15lbs) are being housed in these
innovative enclosures. Adequate space is important for rabbits to support normal behavior and postural adjustments.
Administrator approval for use of innovative enclosures is granted only after careful review and consideration of the
impacts on animal welfare and specific parameters (body weight) are included in this approval. USDA has not approved
the use of these innovative enclosures for rabbits that exceed 11.9lbs. Correct by ensuring all parameters of the approval
for innovative enclosures are met or by housing rabbits in primary enclosures that meet the space requirements in
3.53(c)(2) by 5/12/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
